intro: Linaria perezii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves are features that help it conserve water in its native habitat. Linaria perezii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated in gardens for its unique appearance.
